Description: Habitable rooms include living, sleeping, eating, cooking spaces. Excludes bathrooms, toilet rooms, closets, halls, storage
Single unit with permanent provisions for living, sleeping, eating, cooking, sanitation
Apartment buildings, dormitories, non-transient residential with >2 dwelling units
One and two-family dwellings, townhouses (≤3 stories)
Office, professional, service-type transactions, education >12th grade
Assembly for >50 persons (theaters, restaurants, churches, lecture halls)
Display and sale of merchandise (stores, markets, retail)
Storage not classified as hazardous (warehouses, freight depots)
Single building enclosing tenant spaces with pedestrian mall, anchor stores, food court
Buildings >75 feet (22,860 mm) in building height
Large volume space connecting ≥2 stories, enclosed at top, volume > 1,800 cubic feet
Floor level >30 feet below lowest level of exit discharge
Type V-A construction: 65 feet, 4 stories max for R-3
Type V-B construction: 55 feet, 3 stories max for R-3
Type V-A R-3: 12,000 sq ft per story, 36,000 sq ft total with sprinklers
Mezzanine area ≤ 1/3 of room area in which located, aggregate of all mezzanines ≤ 1/3 floor area
Notes: Not counted as story if compliant

Description: Type I-A: 3-hour columns, 2-hour floors, most restrictive
Type I-B: 2-hour columns, 2-hour floors
Type II-A: 1-hour columns, 1-hour floors
Type III-A: 1-hour exterior walls, interior any material
Type V-A: 1-hour exterior walls, 1-hour floor/ceiling assemblies
Type V-B: No fire resistance rating required
Exterior walls < 5' from property line: 1-hour rated, max 25% openings
Notes: Prevents fire spread to adjacent property

Description: Exterior walls 5-10' from property line: 1-hour rated, max 45% openings
Exterior walls >30' from property line: No rating required, unlimited openings
Fire walls extend from foundation to/through roof, create separate buildings, 3-4 hour rating
Fire barriers separate occupancies, create fire areas, 1-2 hour rating
Fire partitions for corridor walls, dwelling separations, 1 hour rating
Smoke barriers resist smoke passage, typically 1 hour rating
Residential occupancies: 200 feet non-sprinklered, 250 feet sprinklered
Business occupancies: 200 feet non-sprinklered, 300 feet sprinklered
Occupant load 1-500: 2 exits; 501-1,000: 3 exits; >1,000: 4 exits
Two exits required to be separated by ≥ 1/3 diagonal of area served, or 1/2 with sprinklers
Residential dwelling units: 200 sq ft per occupant
Office spaces: 150 sq ft per occupant
Assembly concentrated (fixed seats): 7 sq ft per occupant
Retail sales ground floor: 60 sq ft per occupant; other floors: 120 sq ft per occupant
Residential sprinklered: 125 feet max common path (portion with only one exit direction)
Dead-end corridors: 20 feet max, 50 feet if sprinklered
Interior hinged doors: 5 lbf (22.2 N) maximum opening force
Exterior hinged doors: 15 lbf (66.7 N) maximum opening force
Doors serving spaces with occupant load ≥50 must swing in direction of egress travel
Doors serving occupant load ≥50 require panic hardware or fire exit hardware
Fire doors and smoke doors must be self-closing or automatic-closing
Doors in corridors serving ≥10 occupants require vision panel, 100 sq in minimum
Revolving doors: each door = 50% of required egress capacity, must have adjacent hinged door
Greatest riser height ≤ smallest + 3/8" (9.5 mm) within any flight
Greatest tread depth ≤ smallest + 3/8" (9.5 mm) within any flight
Stair risers minimum 4" (102 mm) height
Stair treads minimum 11" (279 mm) depth measured nosing to nosing
Stairs minimum 44" (1118 mm) clear width between handrails
Stair landings width ≥ width of stairway served
Stair landings length ≥ 44" (1118 mm) in direction of travel
Stair headroom minimum 80" (2032 mm) clearance measured vertically
Handrails extend ≥ 12" (305 mm) beyond top riser, parallel to floor
Handrails extend ≥ tread depth beyond bottom riser, continue slope then ≥12" horizontal
Handrails Type I: 1.25-2" (32-51mm) perimeter; Type II: 4-6.25" (100-160mm) perimeter
Handrails minimum 1.5" (38 mm) clearance from adjacent wall
Handrails must be continuous full length of stair flight
Stairs require minimum 1 fc (11 lux) illumination at all times
Accessible routes: stable, firm, slip-resistant surface, changes in level ≤ 1/2"
Accessible routes: maximum 1:20 (5%) running slope, steeper requires ramp
Accessible routes: maximum 1:48 (2.08%) cross slope
Objects protruding 4-80" (102-2032 mm) height: max 4" (102 mm) projection
Vertical clearance ≥ 80" (2032 mm) along accessible routes
1 accessible space per 1-25 total parking spaces
2 accessible spaces per 26-50 total parking spaces
3 accessible spaces per 51-75 total parking spaces
1 of 6 accessible parking spaces must be van-accessible (98" width + 96" aisle)
Accessible parking spaces require reflectorized sign showing symbol, 60" min height
Thresholds at doorways: max 1/2" (13 mm) height, beveled if > 1/4" (6 mm)
Vision lights in doors: max 43" (1092 mm) bottom height above floor
Door closers: adjusted so door takes ≥ 5 seconds to close from 90° to 12° from latch
Doors with closer and occupant must push: kickplate ≥ 10" (254 mm) height smooth surface
Power-assisted doors: 3-second max opening time, remain open ≥ 30 seconds
Accessible toilet seats: 17-19" (432-483 mm) above floor
Flush controls: hand-operated or automatic, max 44" (1118 mm) height
Toilet paper dispenser: 7-9" (178-229 mm) in front of toilet, max 36" (914 mm) height
Side wall grab bar: 42" (1067 mm) minimum length
Side wall grab bar: 33-36" (838-914 mm) height above floor
Rear wall grab bar: 36" (914 mm) minimum width, centered on toilet
Grab bars: 1.25-2" (32-51 mm) outside diameter
Grab bars: 1.5" (38 mm) minimum spacing from wall
Grab bars: withstand 250 lbf (1112 N) in any direction
Accessible lavatory rim: max 34" (864 mm) height above floor
Knee clearance: 27" (686 mm) minimum height at 8" (203 mm) depth
Toe clearance: 9" (229 mm) minimum height extending 6" (152 mm) beyond knee
Faucets: lever-operated, push, touch, electronic, self-closing (max 10 seconds)
Faucets: max 5 lbf (22.2 N) operating force
Exposed pipes under lavatories: insulated or configured to prevent contact
Total ventilation rate = 0.03 × floor area (ft²) + 7.5 × (bedrooms + 1)
Whole house ventilation must operate continuously or provide equivalent exposure
Kitchen range hood: 100 CFM intermittent or 5 ACH continuous
Bathroom continuous exhaust: 20 CFM minimum
Infiltration credit for ventilation: based on blower door test results
Attached garage: 100 CFM exhaust when occupied, or 0.5 ACH continuous
Vented crawl spaces: 1 ft² per 150 ft² floor area, or sealed with supply air
Offices: 5 CFM/person outdoor air minimum
Conference rooms: 5 CFM/person outdoor air minimum
Reception areas: 5 CFM/person outdoor air minimum
Break/lunch rooms: 5 CFM/person outdoor air minimum
Classrooms ages 9+: 10 CFM/person outdoor air minimum
Retail sales areas: 7.5 CFM/person + 0.12 CFM/ft² minimum
Exercise rooms: 20 CFM/person outdoor air minimum
Locker rooms: 0.5 CFM/ft² outdoor air minimum
Public toilet rooms: 50 CFM per water closet + 20 CFM per urinal exhaust
Enclosed parking: 0.75 CFM/ft² or CO monitoring with variable ventilation
Restaurant dining rooms: 7.5 CFM/person + 0.18 CFM/ft² minimum
Commercial kitchens: makeup air ≥ exhaust air minus 10%
Data processing rooms: maintain temperature/humidity, dedicated HVAC recommended
Hotel guest rooms: 30 CFM per room when occupied
Warehouse storage: 0.06 CFM/ft² outdoor air minimum
Laboratory fume hoods: 100 FPM face velocity minimum, dedicated exhaust
Indoor pools: dedicated dehumidification system, 50-60% RH target
Natatorium spaces: 0.5 CFM/ft² minimum outdoor air
Light hazard occupancy: 1 sprinkler per 130-200 ft² with specific spacing rules
Residential sprinklers: max 144 ft² per head, max 12' spacing
NFPA 13D: sprinklers in habitable spaces, not required in bathrooms, closets < 24 ft²
Smoke alarms: each bedroom, outside each sleeping area, each level including basement
Dwelling smoke alarms: interconnected so activation of one activates all
Smoke alarms: primary power from building wiring, battery backup required
Commercial cooking: Type I hood over equipment producing grease vapors
Commercial cooking: automatic fire suppression system required in Type I hoods
Exit signs: internally illuminated or externally illuminated, visible in normal and emergency
Emergency lighting: min 1 fc average, min 0.1 fc anywhere, 90 minutes duration
Fire doors: self-closing or automatic-closing, latching hardware
Fire door clearances: bottom max 3/4" (19 mm), sides/top max 1/8" (3 mm)
Sprinkler discharge: minimum 18" (457 mm) clearance from storage
Sprinkler systems: annual inspection, 5-year trip test, 10-year hydrostatic
Emergency generators: Level 1 (10 seconds), Level 2 (60 seconds) start time
Electrical panelboards: circuit breaker workingspace 30" wide x 36" deep minimum
GFCI protection: bathrooms, kitchens within 6' of sink, outdoors, garages, unfinished basements
AFCI protection: all 15A and 20A, 120V branch circuits in dwelling units
Receptacles: max 6' from doorway, max 12' apart, or 2' from room corner
Kitchen countertop: receptacle every 4' or within 2' of counter space ≥ 12" wide
Kitchen: minimum 2x 20A small appliance circuits, 1x dedicated refrigerator circuit
Bathroom: minimum 1x 20A dedicated circuit for receptacles
Smoke alarm circuit: dedicated 15A or 20A circuit, AFCI not required
Enclosed parking: CO detection system if mechanically ventilated
Healthcare: essential electrical system with automatic transfer switch (10 seconds)
